meanings.definition: To secure a rope by winding around a cleat or pin.
meanings.sent1: I will belay the rope around the cleat to keep it in place.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to belay the rope securely before climbing.
meanings.sent3: The rope decided to belay itself around the cleat for a nap.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed was like a belay around his goals.
meanings.sent5: The image of the rope belaying around the cleat stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To secure a person with a rope as a safety measure.
meanings.sent1: We must belay the climber to ensure their safety.
meanings.sent2: Remember to always belay someone when they are climbing.
meanings.sent3: The belay made the climber feel like a superhero with a sidekick rope.
meanings.sent4: Her support was a belay that kept him from falling into despair.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of being belayed gave her a sense of security and trust.

meanings.sent1: I had to belay my plans due to unexpected circumstances.
meanings.sent2: The bad weather forced us to belay our outdoor activity.
meanings.sent3: The belay on the event left everyone surprised but relieved.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed was like a belay around his goals.
meanings.sent5: The decision to belay the project was met with mixed reactions.
